column1: Alex Nicolao Telles (born 15 December 1992) is a Brazilian professional footballer who plays as a left-back for Premier League club Manchester United and the Brazil national team.
Telles is highly rated in Brazil and was rewarded with a place in the 2013 Brasileirão Team of the Year.
Telles was born in Caxias do Sul
column2: a city in the Brazilian state of Rio Grande do Sul. At the age of eight
column3: he began playing football with the neighbouring kids and was later enrolled to a youth academy of Esporte Clube Juventude.

column1: Telles began his professional career with Juventude
column2: making his debut on 24 January 2011 against São José-PA. He scored his first goal on 20 August in a 1–1 home draw against Cruzeiro.In December
column3: Telles was transferred to Grêmio after a partnership was established with Juventude. He made his Grêmio debut on 3 February 2013 against Internacional. On 26 May
column4: Telles made his Série A debut
column5: starting in a 2–0 home win against Náutico.

column3: Telles completed a move to Turkish club Galatasaray for  €6 million
column4: signing a contract that will keep him with the club until 2018. He made his debut two weeks later
column5: starting in a 3–0 win against Tokatspor for the campaign's Turkish Cup
column6: and made his maiden Süper Lig debut in a 3–0 home victory against Eskişehirspor on 8 February 2014. Telles made his first assist for the club against Antalyaspor in a 2–2 away game on 17 February. He also scored his first goal for Galatasaray against Akhisar Belediyespor on 8 March in a 6–1 home win.In August 2015
column7: there were rumours mentioning Telles as a good choice to fill the place made by the departure of left-back Filipe Luís at Chelsea. In response to the rumour
column8: Galatasaray manager Hamza Hamzaoğlu said the club would only be tempted by an acceptable offer.

column2: Galatasaray agreed to let Telles join Italian club Internazionale of Serie A on a one-year loan for a €1.3 million fee
column4: 000 if Inter qualify for the group stage of the 2016–17 UEFA Champions League. The deal included a buyout option for €8.5 million
column5: letting Internazionale make the move permanent when the loan deal is finished. Telles reunited with Internazionale manager Roberto Mancini in Italy
column6: who previously coached him at Galatasaray.He made his debut for the club on 13 September in the 2015–16 Serie A matchday 3 against city rivals Milan
column7: playing the entirety of the match as Inter won 1–0.

column6: I ambition a very beautiful story. I have recently commented with my relatives that I do not want to come here in passing

column9: he marked his league debut and first competitive match with a poor performance and subsequent expulsion. Despite the rough start

column11: scoring his first goal when facing rivals Boavista in a 3–1 home victory at Estádio do Dragão.

column2: Manchester United had agreed a deal in principle to sign Alex Telles for a fee believed to be £15.4 million from Porto. The transfer was completed and Telles was announced as a United player that day.

column1: Telles also has an Italian passport
column2: making him in the past eligible to represent Italy national team. In October 2016

column4: adding that his great grandparents are Italian and he feels Italian. In March 2019
column6: he received his first call-up to the Brazil national team. He made his debut for Brazil on 23 March 2019 in a friendly against Panama
